text:
I am trying to use the default handler for doing things like:
    /jnlp/*
The idea would be that all files under /jnlp/* should then be loadable
via the default loader.  But due to (obvious) reasons the default handler loads 
files as:
    /*
This is very misleading and probably causes a lot of security problems.  My 
initial workaround was to use paths like:

anipa@anipa.to
text:
... continued:
    http://www.server.com/jnlp/jnlp/xyzzy.jar
This does return the file I want, but then using paths like causes problems:
    http://www.server.com/jnlp/

We have another servlet configured for / and this is the basic reason for these 
funny paths.

creator: thomas2.maesing@bgs-ag.de
text:
Hi,

I don´t know the obvious reasons. For a mapping like

  <servlet-mapping>
    <servlet-name>default</servlet-name>
    <url-pattern>/test/*</url-pattern>
  </servlet-mapping> 

I would expect a correct handling by the default servlet. But for example
instaed of "/test/test1.html"  "/test1.html" is served.

A patch for the default servlet is attached. I have changed
the getRelativePath(HttpServletRequest request) Method.

Best regards

Thomas

This is normal. The servlet will always use the path info (ie, the part of the
request relative to the path it is mapped to). If you like what your patched
servlet is doing better, then you are free to use it.
I am not in favor of implementing what is suggested in this enhancement.
creator: remm@apache.org
